title: Needs more improvement
author: Boy1421
review: Comparing to Notability, I noticed that this app has worse palm rejection. Even with high sensitivity it still does not reject my palm writing down. I never notice this problem whenever I am using Notability. Also, there are plenty of times wherein the app would just stop functioning like. I often experience not being able to write or highlight on a document for some weird reason and the only way to fix the problem is to close and re-open the app. It‚Äôs these mildly infuriating moments wherein I would prefer using notability over this app. The only real reason why I am still using this app is because of its highlighting feature wherein it highlights behind the words. As of now, it‚Äôs two stars. The team needs to make more improvements to this app.

title: ONE of the BEST notetaking app for a med student BUT..
author: ML Lover BEFORE
review:
From 3 star, I changed my rating to 4 star like what I promised since you guys seems to listen to all your users‚Äô suggestions and tried your very best to adjust and answer all the queries. NOW, why I can‚Äôt give a fully 5 star rating yet? Here‚Äôs why:

1. I‚Äôm solely dependent on your app ever since I became a paperless student. Imagine all of my ebooks, notes, EVERY ESSENTIAL NOTES was on this app and I couldn‚Äôt ask for more because you almost gave all the convenience using this app over the other apps I‚Äôve tried before BUT one of the problem I still encounter ever since I‚Äôm using this app was whenever I import files from other apps or via airdrop going directly to Goodnotes app, there are still cases of LAG or it stops working suddenly and worse, needed to close and reopen the app just to load the file. (Just so you know, I‚Äôm using ipad pro 2 with 512gb and as we all know, apple products don‚Äôt usually have lagging problem :)

2. I‚Äôm really hoping that there will come a time you will offer opening of 2 tabs at the same time. Imagine if we could use 1 tab for ebooks and another 1 tab for other supplemental notes? That will be PERFECTION for every paperless student. PLEASE. (Some might say I should use my 2-tab option on ipad pro, yeah, I‚Äôm already using it for video purposes of what I‚Äôm studying or other supplemental notes as well)

3. Whenever my ipad pro is connected to internet while I‚Äôm using the app, something will pop out in the middle and NOTIFIES EVERY MINUTE something like ‚ÄúNOT ENOUGH ICLOUD STORAGE‚Äù and I already bought additional storage just for that. But due to my succeeding large files, it then started to appear again after few weeks. Is there any way or option to remove that notification? It was REALLY ANNOYING because it pops out whenever I study. 

4. I also wish to have the option to choose for THUMBNAIL SIZE? I mean, there are files sometimes from ppt to pdf, then whenever I import it on Goodnotes app, the thumbnail is so big that EVEN using the BIGGEST SIZE FOR HIGHLIGHTER COULDN‚ÄôT ACCOMMODATE the words I was trying to highlight.

5. I‚Äôm again asking also if you can add a tool for FOOTNOTES or sticky notes. That will be really A BIG HELP. 

6. If it‚Äôs possible to have a RECORD as an additional TOOL, that will be nice as well but if you can‚Äôt still offer that, still fine anyways. 

As promised like before, I‚Äôll change my review if you guys would really help us all students. Please. THIS APP WAS SUCH A GREAT APP, AND MY ONLY HOPE IS FOR YOU TO BE THE BEST APP.

title: Best PDF to review books and handouts
author: skayeeMD
review:
Why do I love it?
- easy exporting and importing files from google drive and dropbox
- easier way to sort handouts and books into different category you prefer
- i love the way how I can easily change the color of my highlighter and pen
- if you want to copy paste a picture or sentences from your browser, just use the split screen and just drag it. Very convenient
- you can add a page from your existing pdf and as well delete the ones you dont need
- some books/pdf dont have a table of content, the feature favorite made it easier for me to transfer from one topic to another
- can open multiple files and can transfer from one tab to another - very PC like
- best use with apple pencil, it really maximizes the benefit you‚Äôll get from this app

title: Handwriting bugs STILL EXIST.
author: alberto-ios
review:
I‚Äôve lost hope with Good Notes. Seeing how bugs never disappear truly makes me angry, but it‚Äôs time to move on.

Since GN already has my money anyway, here‚Äôs my mere two wishes for the next major upgrade. 
1. I wish ‚Äúbug fixes‚Äù become extremely specific: eg. Fixed bug that randomly and often draws additional lines when handwriting (that also existed in 2017 when I first bought the app, which now I remember is why I uninstalled GN in the first place).
2. I also wish these bugs would be on a roadmap that‚Äôs publicly available for the world to see, so the dev team can at least have accountability and dates they‚Äôre chasing. 

It‚Äôs so sad how a bug that doesn‚Äôt exist in other writing apps (Notability, OneNote, the list goes on) still exists in this app after such a long time.

title: I love the app but...
author: Mikee L
review:
I appreciate the addition of the undo redo gestures, but after the last update the changing of the font of any text doesn‚Äôt work, or it just reverts back to the default font.

Also, I do like the folders option, but someday I hope you can implement or add a style of organization similar to evernote or onenote, where we can have multiple subnotebooks and sections in each notebook and we‚Äôll be able to see folders, notebooks, and sections at a side bar that we can pull out when we need to

Can you also add a feature where we can put the toolbar at the right or left side instead of just the bottom or top?

Looking forward to using this app for years to come!

review:
I purchased Goodnotes4 before upgrading to Goodnotes5 yesterday.
My iOS is 12.3.

I have to close my notebook so I can highlight my imported pdf in goodnotes5. It works well then suddenly, it won‚Äôt work so I have to close the notebook I have created and open it again so I can go back to my work. It happened in my law class tonight and it was a little bit annoying. 

I also encountered iCloud sync issues (just now). I hope it would be fine. These are the things I experienced using the upgrade bundle since I had it yesterday.

Thanks for resolving issues.

Sent feedback to improve, and not to be ungrateful.

I love the app, actually.

title: Toolbar at either left or right
author: DocEggy
review:
Really loved goodnotes 4, so jumping to 5 was natural! Please, add an option to move the toolbar to either sides. Much easier to change tools while studying. From med school to residency, your app has been my studybuddy! More power!

Issues:
The long press is driving me insane! Its very buggy. Of course my hand will rest on the screen, but for some reason (whilst the pencil is in full contact on the screen) the app assumes I want to long press on random areas on the screen. It then proceeds to refuse any pencil input until I long press another word to disable the previously buggy long press. Take notes, the area highlighted is just a space. There isnt even a word there. Its forcing me to hover my hand which hurts my wrist!

title: Disappointed!

review: I‚Äôm very disheartened that the app that I‚Äôve been using and loving for over a year now (from GN4) is giving me so much headache! There are SOOOO many bugs that need to be fixed, and I‚Äôm THIS close to switching back to GN4. GN5 is GREAT if not for its bugs. I just can‚Äôt believe you would release an app that isn‚Äôt QUITE ready :( please please fix it. It‚Äôs already bad enough that you had to charge us to UPDATE our current GN4 apps. Most of the apps offer huge updates for free :( I understand that so much work has been put into this but at least fix the bugs :(

Love what youre trying to do but the execution is somewhat lacking.

review:
1) when using the highlighter, after a few minutes it stops working. I couldn't highlight anything then it automatically changes to pen mode but still doesn't write anything. When I tap the highlighter again, it goes back to pen mode. It will work if I reset the app again which is a hassle.

2)when opening a new pdf file, it always takes me automatically to the last page. It's a hassle if i have a 60+ page document and i have to scroll until i could reach the front page.

3)‚ÄºÔ∏èADD A 2-FINGER DOUBLE TAP FEATURE‚ÄºÔ∏èDouble tapping would be really helpful especially when changing highlighter colors often!

review:
Personally, I am very pleased with the new updates. I like that words, photos, etc can be rotated now. The new brush pen and color wheel features are very cool, thank you for adding those! The new paper and cover templates are fantastic as well.
However, there are instances wherein there is a noticeable lag, especially when erasing and undo-ing actions. It would be highly appreciated if this malfunction was fixed as soon as possible.

title: Night mode please
author: jgy009
review:
Most of the new features are good, especially the 3 customizable quick access presets for color and ink thickness. No lags or bugs (so far) in my gen 1 iPad Pro.

An additional feature that I wrote for Goodnotes 4 was the inclusion of a dark theme/night mode wherein I can use black paper and change to black paper background for notebooks and imported PDF files. The night mode for pdf files is already available in numerous free PDF readers. I hope this is included as it reduces the strain in the eyes.

title: Room for improvement
author: Tric 77
review:
I was overjoyed to hear about the new upgrade and the awesome new features! I‚Äôd love to give a 5-star rating if some issues were addressed.(I understand though since the app was just released)

Issues so far:
- crashes
- some lag (especially, the undo feature)

Some shameless request:
1. Is it possible to bring back the ff. features:

Papers can be rotated easily
I can scroll vertically and horizontally

title: Newer Doesn‚Äôt Necessarily Mean Better
author: ihaveafridge
review:
In general, I absolutely love the product. I‚Äôm a big fan of Goodnotes 4 and will probably continue to use it until there‚Äôs no support for it. I excitedly upgraded to Goodnotes 5 but was very disappointed. Some comments:

1. Goodnotes 5 lacks response / is quite slow. I‚Äôm using a first generation iPad pro 12.9 in. I would think that my device should still have decent power to run this app smoothly. Some of my writing seems to momentarily disappear. 

2. When looking for a particular notebook, I‚Äôd prefer that the thumbnails / coverage page (if that‚Äôs what they‚Äôre called) be bigger... just like in Goodnotes 4. Or at least have the option to make them bigger.

3. I‚Äôm very particular about the preset font colors from Goodnotes 4. I couldn‚Äôt match the exact green and red that I was previously using. I get it that I should be able to use the hex codes, etc to get the exact color, but couldn‚Äôt Goodnotes just match Goodnotes 5 with Goodnotes 4?

4. I‚Äôm also very particular about my pen size. In Goodnotes 4, I used 2.7 which is like a 0.6 equivalent in Goodnotes 5. I just wish they were exactly the same so I wouldn‚Äôt have to guess the ‚Äúconversion‚Äù. 

5. Some templates from Goodnotes 4 are no longer available on Goodnotes 5. Sure, I could just import them from Goodnotes 4, but I wish I wouldn‚Äôt have to. The upgrade should make things easier... not more difficult.

6. Maybe it‚Äôs just me, but I had a quick discussion with my colleageus and we all felt the UI/UX of Goodnotes 4 was simple, intuitive, and got the job done for us. Goodnotes 5 incorporates changes that may not be bad, but they‚Äôre not necessarily better. We almost feel like the change was for the sake of change.

To the developers of Goodnotes, like I previously said, I‚Äôm a big fan. But please, get Goodnotes 5 right before you stop supporting Goodnotes 4. Many of the new features incorporated could have just been done on Goodnotes 4 (like that filing system, global search, etc). I‚Äôm sure the more I use it, the more comments I will have. But for now, I‚Äôll just use Goodnotes 4. I‚Äôm hoping your subsequent upgrades will cover at least some of my comments. Thank you.

Way to go.

review:
